campaign_variables.description: (IN GAME) When abandoning settlements; percentage modifier on income
(IN GAME) Public order penatly for each settlement abandoned, for each province the faction ownes. Applies next turn only.
(IN GAME) Public order penatly for each settlement abandoned, for each province the faction ownes. Stored value reducing by 1 each turn.
(IN GAME) If an additional rebel army were to spawn in a region, change the army generator budget variable 'quality multiplier' by this
(IN GAME) If an additional rebel army were to spawn in a region, change the army generator budget variable 'quality offset' by this
(IN GAME) If an additional rebel army were to spawn in a region, damage the buildings by this percent
Upper bound inclusive target character loyalty for performing "kick character" action
Lower bound inclusive target character loyalty for performing "reduce character loyalty" action
Upper bound inclusive target character loyalty for performing "reduce character loyalty" action
(IN GAME) Number of rounds gates will be sabotaged for agent actions
(IN GAME) Modifier value used during independence scoring logic for AI entities
(IN GAME) Percentage chance whether or not to grant independence to AI factions
(IN GAME) Time in seconds that the attackers reinforcements are delayed by in an ambush

(IN GAME) Ambush will roll on chance of success, generated from ground type and bonus values. The chance of failure is split into failure and critical failure. The propotion of failure that is critical is defined here. Clamped between 0.0 and 1.0
(IN GAME) Width of area of interest splines
(IN GAME) Percentage of the maximum garrisoned army armed citizenry force that will exist immediately after a region has changed hands.
(IN GAME) Percentage of the maximum garrisoned navy armed citizenry force that will exist immediately after a region has changed hands.
(IN GAME) Losing alliance must be at least below X unary of maximum for wipe out. from 0.0 to 1.0. E.g. Force max soldiers is 200, end soldier count is 50, threshold will check against 50/200 = 0.25.
(IN GAME) Winning alliance must be above X proportion strength to wipe out loser. Must be positive. E.g. Winner has 200 units, Loser has 30 units, calculation will check against (200/30) = 6.66
(IN GAME) Damage multiplier for full naval units in autoresolver sea battles. 1.0 is no change.
(IN GAME) Damage multiplier for army transport units in autoresolver sea battles. 1.0 is no change.
(IN GAME) Scale for damage applied by excess melee units in the autoresolver. Must be > 0.
(IN GAME) Scale for damage recieved by excess melee units in the autoresolver. Must be > 0.
(IN GAME) Maximum multiplier for morale damage a unit can take from siege towers in one round
(IN GAME) Modifier on the missile range used in ranged combat. Units will query the BCOP using a range of THIS*effective_missile_range.
(IN GAME) Damage multiplier to ramming damage of ships. Ramming damage is applied at the same time as melee damage.
(IN GAME) Initial seperation when calculating ship ramming damage in unit vs unit. Combat prediction is Ramming vs Passive.
(IN GAME) Number of towers for the defender in fortified autoresolver battle.
(IN GAME) Number of towers for the defender in unfortified autoresolver battle.
(IN GAME) The battle time a reinforcement arrives on the field. 0 will be instant (waiting for them to arrive). Must be positive
(IN GAME) variation in autoresolver predictions. Must be positive or 0.
(IN GAME) variation in autoresolver predictions. Must be positive or 0.
(IN GAME) variation in autoresolver predictions. Must be positive or 0.
(IN GAME) variation in autoresolver predictions. Must be positive or 0.
(IN GAME) variation in autoresolver predictions. Must be positive or 0.

(IN GAME) Scales the generals autoresolver accuracy. The scale is linear from (0 units) to (THIS value), with the accuracy multiplied from (0) to (1). The scale is calculated as ((lowest num units in alliace) / THIS)
(IN GAME) Initial seperation of armies in an autoresolver siege battle
(IN GAME) The time step of autoresolver battles. Must be positive. Small values will misrepresent unit stats. Large values will misrepresent range and movement.
(IN GAME) Base kps for towers. Kps is reduced by target unit shield effectiveness and target unit size.
(IN GAME) Multiplier on autoresolver tower damage for level 1 towers. Calculated as (damage = (base_damage * THIS))
(IN GAME) Multiplier on autoresolver tower damage for level 2 towers. Calculated as (damage = (base_damage * THIS))
(IN GAME) Multiplier on autoresolver tower damage for level 3 towers. Calculated as (damage = (base_damage * THIS))
(IN GAME) Multiplier on autoresolver tower damage for level 4 towers. Calculated as (damage = (base_damage * THIS))
(IN GAME) Number of rounds after melee that towers continue to fire for in the autoresolver
(IN GAME) Maximum ammo per sec based on full unit size. Max ammo per second is VALUE * unit_size.
(IN GAME) Max melee kills per second proportion of enemy unit. Kills per second can only be VALUE times larger than opponent.
(IN GAME) Max ranged kills per second. Flat amount, must be VALUE or below.
(IN GAME) Minimum kills per second at full strength. Min kills per second is VALUE * combat time (calculated in combat prediction)
(IN GAME) Min kills per ammo is AMMO USED / (VALUE) * full unit size
(IN GAME) Min ranged kills per second flat value.
(IN GAME) Autoresolver percentage building damage per enemy siege euqipment
(IN GAME) Autoresolver percentage building damage per enemy unit
(IN GAME) When alliance has more units in melee than opponent (excess melee units), the amount of damage they take from the unit they attack
(IN GAME) Multiplier for chase down damage (post battle)
(IN GAME) multiply the chase down damage by this modifier for losing units
(IN GAME) maximum damage done in chase down phase, as a unary of full health
(IN GAME) maximum value for the speed comparison calculation
(IN GAME) used in the speed comparison calcuation
(IN GAME) multiply the surviver units ratio by this value
(IN GAME) multiply the chase down damage by this modifier for winning units
(IN GAME) The difference in heath lost to mark a unit to have damaged transferred from them. E.g. 0.2 means that if the average health lost is 0.15, units with health loss of > 0.35 will be marked.
(IN GAME) Value > 0 to enable post battle damage transfer

(IN GAME) The max difference from average health lost. E.g. 0.3 means that if the average health loss it 0.15, transferring units should lose a maximum of 0.45. The exact value depends on the original damage taken, and will be in the range (0.15-0.45) in this example
(IN GAME) The minimum proportion of health a "transfering to" unit can drop to. E.g. 0.2 means that units won't drop below 20% of their max health
(IN GAME) Proportion of damaged units that are split into the "transfer damage from" list. All theer damaged units are put into the "transfer damage to" list
(IN GAME) Modification to duel chance which scales with the number of duels that have already occured in this battle
(IN GAME) Base chance of duel to happen in the autoresolver
(IN GAME) Max autoresolver duel chance
(IN GAME) Min. autoresolver duel chance
(IN GAME) Modification to duel chance which scales with the number of characters in the battle
(IN GAME) Max number of duels that can occur in the autoresolver
(IN GAME) Controls how a large a difference in combat potential between two characters is necessary for them to refuse a duel

(IN GAME) If non-zero then when the autoresolver is calculating outcomes between a flying unit and a non-flying melee unit in a skirmish situation then the flying unit uses the entire skirmish combat time.
(IN GAME) Percentage modifier on damage dealt by flying creatures to non-flying creatures in melee in the autoresolver.
(IN GAME) Percentage modifier on damage received by flying creatures from non-flying creatures in melee in the autoresolver.
(IN GAME) Amount by which the autoresolver unary mana pool is reduced per round, per point of mana cost of all spells in an alliance.
(IN GAME) Sim based battle, the maximum number of units that can attack a single enemy unit in excess melee flanking
(IN GAME) Sim based battle, the maximum number of units that can attack a single enemy unit in excess melee
(IN GAME) Used in autoresolver modifiers. Enemey hp modifier is multiplied by (MAX_HP - ENEMY_HP) / (MAX_HP - MIN_HP).
(IN GAME) The min battle time before units can retreat. Must be positive
(IN GAME) Used in autoresolver modifiers. Enemey hp modifier is multiplied by (MAX_HP - ENEMY_HP) / (MAX_HP - MIN_HP).
(IN GAME) Number of excess melee units that take damage from their targets
(IN GAME) The number of units on the field multiplier to allow units to retreat. can retreat if num_units * VALUE > enemy_num_units.
(IN GAME) KPS modifier applied in the autoresolver by a buff special ability with scaled combat potential of one.
(IN GAME) KPS modifier applied in the autoresolver by a buff special ability with scaled combat potential of zero.
(IN GAME) Combat potential value for special abilities in autoresolver that results in a scaled combat potential of one.
(IN GAME) Damage done in the autoresolver by a damage special ability with scaled combat potential of one.
(IN GAME) Damage done in the autoresolver by a damage special ability with scaled combat potential of zero.
(IN GAME) The maximum distance between the closest opposing units in the autoresolver before damage special abilities will be used.
(IN GAME) KPS modifier applied in the autoresolver by a debuff special ability with scaled combat potential of one.
(IN GAME) KPS modifier applied in the autoresolver by a debuff special ability with scaled combat potential of zero.
(IN GAME) Scaled combat potentials in the autoresolver are clamped to be no higher than this when applied.
(IN GAME) Scaled combat potentials in the autoresolver are clamped to be no lower than this when applied.
(IN GAME) Starting unit stregth retreat threshold. Between 0 and 1. unit retreats is strength is less than VALUE * 100 percent.
(IN GAME) Remaning strength of a unit to wipe out. Unit will be wiped out if strength percentage < VALUE * 100. Between 0 and 1
(IN GAME) Autoresolver percentage wall damage per enemy srtillery unit
(IN GAME) Autoresolver percentage building damage per enemy siege euqipment if defenders lose
(IN GAME) Autoresolver percentage building damage per enemy unit if defenders lose
(IN GAME) Autoresolver wall damage, additional damage per additional wall breach
(IN GAME) Kills per casualty for battle to be major win. Major win if KPC is > VALUE
(IN GAME) Kills per casualty for battle to be major win. Minor win if KPC is < VALUE
(IN GAME) Strength lost for an army to wipe out. Army will be wiped out if strength lost percentage > VALUE * 100. Between 0 and 1
(IN GAME) Number of resource units always available on the global market for each resource (to prevent division by zero).
(IN GAME) Percentage of building cost refunded when a building is dismantled
(IN GAME) Base number of retinues deployable per turn. Can be increased by bonus values.
(IN GAME) The number of new, upgrade and conversion building construction items that are permitted to be in progress in one faction province at any one time. Can be increased by bonus values.
(IN GAME) Base number of active undercover characters a faction can have
(IN GAME) The besiegers force size as a percentage of the besieged force size must exceed this threshold for besieged attrition to apply
(IN GAME) The blockaders force size as a percentage of the blockaded force size must exceed this threshold for blockade attrition to apply
(IN GAME) Additional starting funds on easy difficulty
(IN GAME) Additional starting funds on normal difficulty
(IN GAME) Campaign map border widths
(IN GAME) Campaign map overlay border widths
(IN GAME) Distance to check from the end of an attackers path to find river crossings when detecting river battles
(IN GAME) Percentage (as a decimal) cost reduction to buildings which are converted
(IN GAME) Multiplier to the cost of converting a building from another culture. This can be modified by bonus values.
(IN GAME) Multiplier to the time of converting a building from another culture. This can be modified by bonus values.
(IN GAME) Minimum cost of coverting a building, cultural or normal conversion.
(IN GAME) The number of turns a slot is empty or ruined before turning into a slum.
(IN GAME) The base cost of dismantling a slum. This can be modified by bonus values. This can be modified by bonus values.
(IN GAME) If non-zero then building upkeep is charged as soon as a building starts constructing.
(IN GAME) Multiplier for dismantle building instant complete cost..
(IN GAME) Set the far plane distance of the campaign camera", "Sets the far plane distance of the campaign camera
(IN GAME) Rate of zoom modifier when using the hotkey
(IN GAME) Set the max distance from the actual target to the real target
(IN GAME) Depth of field near/far falloff multiplier applied at maximum camera height
(IN GAME) Set the field of view angle of the campaign camera", "Sets the field of view angle of the campaign camera
(IN GAME) Set the max height for the camera
(IN GAME) Set the maximum tilt angle of the campaign camera", "Sets the maximum tilt angle of the campaign camera relative to -y
(IN GAME) Set the min distance from the actual target to the real target
(IN GAME) Depth of field near/far falloff multiplier applied at minimum camera height
(IN GAME) Set the field of view angle of the campaign camera", "Sets the field of view angle of the campaign camera
(IN GAME) Set the min height for the camera
(IN GAME) Set the minimum tilt angle of the campaign camera", "Sets the minimum tilt angle of the campaign camera relative to -y
(IN GAME) Rate of zoom modifier when using the mousewheel
(IN GAME) Set the near plane distance of the campaign camera", "Sets the near plane distance of the campaign camera
(IN GAME) The minimum point along the camera spline which the camera can reach
(IN GAME) Horizontal position of the camera spline first segment first control point
(IN GAME) Vertical position of the camera spline first segment first control point
(IN GAME) Horizontal position of the camera spline first segment second control point
(IN GAME) Vertical position of the camera spline first segment second control point
(IN GAME) Camera spline first segment distance
(IN GAME) Camera spline first segment height
(IN GAME) Horizontal position of the camera spline second segment first control point
(IN GAME) Vertical position of the camera spline second segment first control point
(IN GAME) Horizontal position of the camera spline second segment second control point
(IN GAME) Vertical position of the camera spline second segment second control point
(IN GAME) Camera spline second segment distance
(IN GAME) Camera spline second segment height
(IN GAME) Horizontal position of the camera spline third segment first control point
(IN GAME) Vertical position of the camera spline third segment first control point
(IN GAME) Horizontal position of the camera spline third segment second control point
(IN GAME) Vertical position of the camera spline third segment second control point
(IN GAME) Camera spline third segment distance
(IN GAME) Camera spline third segment height
(IN GAME) Set the far plane distance of the campaign camera", "Sets the far plane distance of the campaign camera
(IN GAME) Set the field of view angle of the campaign camera", "Sets the field of view angle of the campaign camera
(IN GAME) The maximum height the camera can reach in campaign
(IN GAME) Set the maximum tilt angle of the campaign camera", "Sets the maximum tilt angle of the campaign camera relative to -y
(IN GAME) The minimum height the camera can reach in campaign
(IN GAME) Set the minimum tilt angle of the campaign camera", "Sets the minimum tilt angle of the campaign camera relative to -y
(IN GAME) Rate of zoom when using the mousewheel
(IN GAME) Set the near plane distance of the campaign camera", "Sets the near plane distance of the campaign camera
(IN GAME) How many units does the camera move forward as it approaches max tilt
(IN GAME) Height at which the camera zooms usign the faster step value
(IN GAME) Faster rate of zoom for camera
(IN GAME) Height at wchich blending in of the parchment map starts, starting at 0% opacity and reaching 100% at zoom threshold 2
(IN GAME) First tilt threshold height
(IN GAME) Portion of the range between min tilt and max tilt the tilt threshold 2 represents
(IN GAME) Second tilt threshold height
(IN GAME) Portion of the range between min tilt and max tilt the tilt threshold 1 represents
The height threshold where we change to simpler representation of settlement and army icons
(IN GAME) The height at which the parchment overlay becomes visible
(IN GAME) Maximum height the campaign map camera will scroll to. Actual height not scale or normal.

(IN GAME) Campaign diplomacy treaty components with display priority below this value will not be displayed in the event feed. If all components in a deal are below this priority the deal will not show up at all.
The minimum faction potential difference used to bias autoresolver battles fought between A.I. factions under the shroud
Faction potential used for A.I. vs player battles on easy difficulty
Faction potential used for A.I. vs player battles on hard difficulty
Faction potential used for A.I. vs player battles on legendary difficulty
Faction potential used for A.I. vs player battles on normal difficulty
Faction potential used for A.I. vs player battles on vhard difficulty
difficulty modifier for campaign faction potential on easy difficulty
difficulty modifier for campaign faction potential on hard difficulty
difficulty modifier for campaign faction potential on legendary difficulty
difficulty modifier for campaign faction potential on normal difficulty
difficulty modifier for campaign faction potential on very hard difficulty
Minimum difference in faction potential which will cause kills per second modification to be applien in the autoresolver
Maximum faction potential delta between two factions in autoresolver battle
Maximum multiplier for hit point regain after autoresolver battle
Maximum kills per second multiplier applied due to faction potential differences in the autoresolver
Maximum possible value of faction potential
Minimum possible value of faction potential
maximum faction potential modification multiplier for A.I. vs A.I. battles in the shroud
(IN GAME) Maximum amount of turns a character being idle can effect their loyalty for
(IN GAME) Maximum amount of turns a character not being idle can effect their loyalty for
(IN GAME) Basic amount of treasury to gain when executing a character. Multiplied by wealth level
(IN GAME) Additive percentage modifier applied to a characters escape chance if they're on their last wound.
(IN GAME) Maximum number of characters that can be captured during a battle
(IN GAME) Minimum rank a character must achieve before being valid for capture
(IN GAME) Increased value of character captive if they have a past experience with the capturing faction
(IN GAME) Increased value of the character captive if they have a relationship with a character in the capturing faction
(IN GAME) Increased value of character captive if they have a relationship with a character present in the capturing force
(IN GAME) Base time for which a character will convalesce
(IN GAME) Maximum age for new characters
(IN GAME) Minimum age for new characters
(IN GAME) Weighting factor for sorting algorithm used for determining preferred faction to defect based on faction stance
(IN GAME) Weighting factor for sorting algorithm used for determining preferred faction to defect
(IN GAME) Weight factor used when picking preferred non civil war faction
(IN GAME) Number of rounds a character spends in a faction before they are eligible for defection
(IN GAME) Weight factor used when picking preferred non civil war faction
(IN GAME) Weight factor used when picking preferred non civil war faction
(IN GAME) Amount of loyalty a character gains as a boost when they join a new faction
(IN GAME) Amount of loyalty the new faction boost decays by every turn
(IN GAME) Upper bound for size of per-faction pools that are not assigned to any group
(IN GAME) Median size of per-faction pools that are not assigned to any group
(IN GAME) Lower bound for size of per-faction pools that are not assigned to any group
(IN GAME) Frequency of full updates to character pools
(IN GAME) Frequency of partial updates to character pools
(IN GAME) Target characters in each character pool
(IN GAME) Period before the character pools redistribuition begins
(IN GAME) Upper bound of random spouse age
(IN GAME) Lower bound of random spouse age
(IN GAME) Maximum value that a character relationship value ascend to
(IN GAME) Minimum value that a character relationship can degrade to
(IN GAME) The minimum value at which the relationship payload will display the large ui_payload_record
(IN GAME) The number of turns after retiring a general before they are available to be recruited again.
(IN GAME) default num turns wounds last on a character
(IN GAME) (sum of joining separatists rank / sum of loyalists rank) >= this value
(IN GAME) Percentage of building cost refunded when a damaged building is dismantled
(IN GAME) gamewide multiplier on retinue deploy cost
(IN GAME) Number of turns taken for the landscape to recover after a destruction incident
(IN GAME) Number of factions to be behind, hard difficulty
(IN GAME) Number of turns to be behind for, hard difficulty
(IN GAME) Amount of prestige to be behind by, hard difficulty
(IN GAME) Number of factions to be behind, normal difficulty
(IN GAME) Number of turns to be behind for, normal difficulty
(IN GAME) Amount of prestige to be behind by, normal difficulty
(IN GAME) Number of factions to be behind, very hard difficulty
(IN GAME) Number of turns to be behind for, very hard difficulty
(IN GAME) Amount of prestige to be behind by, very hard difficulty
(IN GAME) Number of factions to be ahead of, easy difficulty
(IN GAME) Number of turns to be ahead for, easy difficulty
(IN GAME) Amount of prestige to be ahead by, easy difficulty
(IN GAME) Number of factions to be ahead of, hard difficulty
(IN GAME) Number of turns to be ahead for, hard difficulty
(IN GAME) Amount of prestige to be ahead by, hard difficulty
(IN GAME) Number of factions to be ahead of, normal difficulty
(IN GAME) Number of turns to be ahead for, normal difficulty
(IN GAME) Amount of prestige to be ahead by, normal difficulty
(IN GAME) If zero then factions by default take a diplomatic hit when moving armies into other faction territory (Total War: Rome 2-style military access)
(IN GAME) If zero then factions by default are physically unable to move armies into other faction territory (Empire: Total War-style military access)
(IN GAME) If non-zero then factions can trade regions that are not adjacent to the recipient or are adjacent to them but cannot be traversed to.

(IN GAME) If diplomacy_can_trade_regions_to_recipient_regardless_of_adjacency_and_traversability is zero and this is non-zero then factions can trade regions that are adjacent to the recipient but not traversable from the recipient.

(IN GAME) If diplomacy_can_trade_regions_to_recipient_regardless_of_adjacency_and_traversability and diplomacy_can_trade_regions_which_are_adjacent_to_recipient_but_not_traversably_so are both zero and this is non-zero then factions can trade regions that are adjacent to the recipient but not traversable from the recipient if the region is in a province where the recipient owns at least one other region.
(IN GAME) The maximum amount of its income a client state or vassal will give to its protector or master each turn.
(IN GAME) If non-zero then show messages for trespassing armies at the start of each turn.
(IN GAME) Global scale applied to all buildings in the game
(IN GAME) Base scale applied to characters on campaign map.
(IN GAME) The time in seconds for movement arrow to fade in or out.
(IN GAME) The time in seconds for movement extents to fade in or out.
(IN GAME) The time in seconds for settlement land areas to fade in or out.
(IN GAME) The time in seconds for settlement sea areas to fade in or out.
(IN GAME) Base scale applied to ships on campaign map.
(IN GAME) Hour we fast forward to when day battle is selected
(IN GAME) Size of range we use uniform random at to add value to 'display_time_of_day_day_battle_hour' in the middle
(IN GAME) Hour we fast forward to when night battle is selected
(IN GAME) Size of range we use uniform random at to add value to 'display_time_of_day_night_battle_hour' in the middle
(IN GAME) Length in seconds of transition to/from night battle
(IN GAME) Time of day speed multiplier
(IN GAME) Time of day speed multiplier for AI turn
(IN GAME) How blue naval trade routes are when used by enemy factions and neutral factions who are blockaded (0-255).
(IN GAME) How green naval trade routes are when used by enemy factions and neutral factions who are blockaded (0-255).
(IN GAME) How red naval trade routes are when used by enemy factions and neutral factions who are blockaded (0-255).

(IN GAME) DOF, Bokeh sprite splat intensity

(IN GAME) DOF, Radius of blur kernal in the background

(IN GAME) Modifier applied to gdp when calculating economic power
(IN GAME) Upper bound for economic power
(IN GAME) Lower bound for economic power
(IN GAME) Modifier applied to current treasury when calculating economic power
(IN GAME) In diplomacy, when demanding payments from AI, if the economic strength is at least this high, the wealth category of the AI faction will be at least moderate (or higher)
(IN GAME) In diplomacy, when demanding payments from AI, if the economic strength is at least this high, the wealth category of the AI faction will be at least strong (or higher)
(IN GAME) In diplomacy, when demanding payments from AI, if the economic strength is at least this high, the wealth category of the AI faction will be very strong
(IN GAME) In diplomacy, when demanding payments from AI, if the economic strength is at least this high, the wealth category of the AI faction will be at least weak (or higher)
(IN GAME) The upper limit on the amount of money the player can demand from a faction in diplomacy if the target faction's wealth level is in the medium category.
(IN GAME) The upper limit on the amount of money the player can demand from a faction in diplomacy if the target faction's wealth level is in the high category.
(IN GAME) The upper limit on the amount of money the player can demand from a faction in diplomacy if the target faction's wealth level is in the highest category.
(IN GAME) The upper limit on the amount of money the player can demand from a faction in diplomacy if the target faction's wealth level is in the lowest category.
(IN GAME) The upper limit on the amount of money the player can demand from a faction in diplomacy if the target faction's wealth level is in the low category.

(IN GAME) For each army in settle stance in client/vassal regions, the units will be summed up and NUM_UNITS*VALUE extra tribute will be granted to the master/protector. This is a percentage, should be 0-100.
(IN GAME) Maximum extra tribute from armies settled in client/vassal regions. This is a percentage, should be between 0-100.
(IN GAME) Start pos character employment history will display a random initial join date between the campaign start date and this many turns into the past. Will not override coming of age limits.
(IN GAME) Characters rejoining the same faction within this round limit will not get an additional employment history entry
(IN GAME) If non-zero scripted pathfinding restrictions are enabled at start of game.
(IN GAME) Amount of provincial supplies below which the player will receive an end turn notification that one of their provinces has low resources
(IN GAME) Number of rounds that must have elapsed since the last faction council mission was issued, to warn the player about it with an end turn notification
(IN GAME) Treasury amount below which the player will receive an end turn warning. Paired with low_funds_income_amount
(IN GAME) Income amount below which the player will receive an end turn warning. Paired with low_funds_amount
(IN GAME) Public order balance below which the player will receive an end turn warning about a provinces public order
(IN GAME) How many hitpoints are replenished on hitpoint using units for each captive when enslaving captives post-battle.

(IN GAME) For post-battle replenishment, defines rhe most extreme difference in percentage replenishment between two units, i.e. a value of 2 means that at most one unit might replenish twice as many men as another. The higher the number, the less uniform the replenishment. Minimum value is one.

(IN GAME) The maximum percentage of your original army that will be replenished via the post-battle captives option for the AI on hard difficulty.

(IN GAME) Additional chance (unary) of generating an event at the start of a round. Added for every round elapsed that an event was not generated on
(IN GAME) Additional weighting to generate a dilemma added per-round since the last dilemma generated
(IN GAME) Additional weighting to generate a incident added per-round since the last incident generated
(IN GAME) Additional weighting to generate a mission added per-round since the last mission generated
(IN GAME) Base chance of generating an event at the start of a round (unary)
(IN GAME) Base chance of generating a dilemma over a mission or incident
(IN GAME) [PERCENTAGE] Base chance of an event firing if there's no VAR CHANCE defined for it
(IN GAME) Base chance of generating an incident over a mission or dilemma
(IN GAME) Base chance of generating a mission over an incident or dilemma
(IN GAME) Minimum number of rounds between random events
(IN GAME) First round that random events can start to occur
(IN GAME) Any character specified rank value will be killed instead of being added back to pool
(IN GAME) Percentage chance to consider picking highest priority fond faction during character pool redistribution
(IN GAME) Background gdp value.
(IN GAME) Background gdp value for minor nations.
(IN GAME) The base percentage of the region gdp that the owning faction gains from the region when a governor is present.
(IN GAME) Maximum multiplier that diplomatic events can contribute to direct strategic threat calculations
(IN GAME) Multiplier applied to allied forces military strength before being combined with the factions own military strength
(IN GAME) Maximum multiplier that diplomatic events can contribute to strategic threat calculations
(IN GAME) Maximum age (in rounds) a diplomatic event can be before it stops counting towards strategic threat calculations
(IN GAME) This is used as a multiplier to the number of regions a faction has that is used in strategic threat calculations.
(IN GAME) This is used as a flat bonus to strategic threat calculations, if the faction is a world leader.
(IN GAME) This is used as a flat bonus to strategic threat calculations, if an ally or a master is a world leader.
(IN GAME) If zero then factions involved in civil wars cannot confederate with other factions.
(IN GAME) If zero then factions involved in civil wars cannot be confederated by other factions.
(IN GAME) Factionwide recruitment, base multiplier on recruitment time
(IN GAME) Factionwide recruitment, number of additional buildings required to reduce recruitment time
(IN GAME) The age at which family members can first be considered adults.
(IN GAME) The age at which family members will definitely be considered adults.
(IN GAME) The base chance of family members having a child.
(IN GAME)
(IN GAME) The percentage chance that a character will have a bastard child
(IN GAME)
(IN GAME) The chance each turn that a child of appropriate age will be considered adult.

(IN GAME) The minimum age of a daimyo created on faction emergence.
(IN GAME) The percentage chance a child willl die before the age of 6
(IN GAME) The percentage chance a child will die before they come of age
(IN GAME) The number of rounds that must pass after a child is born before the parents may have another child.

(IN GAME) The number of turns at start of game before any non-adult family member can be considered adult.
(IN GAME) The age at which women cease to have children.
(IN GAME) Chance of a fully AI battle being added as a famous battle.

(IN GAME) Part of food shortage system. Defines maximum income bonus for positive food effects.
(IN GAME) Part of food shortage system. Defines scaling factor for income bonus for positive food effects. Applied after cap is applied.

(IN GAME) Part of food shortage system. Defines maximum penalty for local food shortage effects (for non-hordes)
(IN GAME) Part of food shortage system. Defines maximum morale mod bonus for negative food effects.
(IN GAME) Part of food shortage system. Defines maximum replenishment mod bonus for negative food effects.

(IN GAME) Unmodified lower bound for large gifts
(IN GAME) Unmodified lower bound for medium gifts
(IN GAME) Unmodified lower bound for small gifts

(IN GAME) The percentage modifier on tax administation cost of regions where a governor is present.
(IN GAME) Home region suitability scoring - bonus if a region is your original home region
(IN GAME) Home region suitability scoring - bonus if a region is your original home region and is a province capital
(IN GAME) Home region suitability scoring - province capital
(IN GAME) Home region suitability scoring - world leader region
(IN GAME) Base dev points for newly created horde armies
(IN GAME) Base dev point cost for new hordes

(IN GAME) Infighting GDP ai percentage mod per army

(IN GAME) Infighting GDP percentage mod per army

(IN GAME) Fraction modifier on the fraction of the unit recruitment recieved in loot for killing men in that unit

(IN GAME) Upper bound for ranger we pick uniform random number to add to 'map_road_objects_display_spawn_interval_min' value when checking if new map road object model can be spawned. Seconds.
(IN GAME) Minimum interval between new map road object spawns from the same region. Seconds.
(IN GAME) Minimum trade model spawn frequency that is set when trade value is map_road_objects_display_trade_frequency_value_max

(IN GAME) Upper bound for trade value used for trade model spawn frequency calculation
(IN GAME) Lower bound for trade value used for trade model spawn frequency calculation
(IN GAME) The settlement development level that uses that maximum number of civilians. Lower settlement development level will use ((development level / THIS) * max num civilians) civilians.
(IN GAME) The max number of civilians that can be deployed in a non settlement battle (for largest unit sizes). Also determines the max number of civilians that can be deployment in custom battles!
(IN GAME) The max number of civilians that can be deployed in a settlement battle (for largest unit sizes)
(IN GAME) Max number of wall mounted artillery provided to battle. This must be set to the minimum across all battle maps.
(IN GAME) Maximum allowed siege equipment
(IN GAME) The maximum possible amount of daimyo honour.
(IN GAME) The maximum possible amount of general loyalty.
(IN GAME) Maximum number of world leader regions
(IN GAME) To calculate dev cost to build in empty slot for military forces. Cost is (THIS * num slots built on). Must be > 0.
(IN GAME) To calculate military force building damage due to attrition. Will damage buildings random THIS health for every (CVAR) percentage attrition suffered.
(IN GAME) To calculate military force building damage due to attrition. Will damage buildings random (CVAR) health for every THIS percentage attrition suffered.
(IN GAME) To calculate military force building damage due to battle loss.. Will damage buildings random THIS health for every (CVAR) percentage battle damage suffered.
(IN GAME) To calculate military force building damage due to battle loss. Will damage buildings random (CVAR) health for every THIS percentage battle damage suffered.
(IN GAME) To calculate military force building damage due to sabotage. Will damage buildings random THIS health for every (CVAR) percentage unit sobtage damage suffered.
(IN GAME) To calculate military force building damage due to sabotage. Will damage buildings random (CVAR) health for every THIS percentage unit sobtage damage suffered.
(IN GAME) To calculate the dev point refund after razing a military force building. Refund is (total spent on building * THIS). Myst be > 0.
(IN GAME) To calculate the dev point repair cost for military forces. Repair cost is (THIS * dev cost of building level being repaired). Must be > 0.
(IN GAME) Maximum num development points a military force can store.
(IN GAME) Military force growth required for a new development point. Is code restricted to be at least 1.
(IN GAME) Morale modifier due to attrition
(IN GAME) Morale penalty while bankrupt

(IN GAME) Morale bonus from winning a battle

(IN GAME) Max unspent development points in a province

(IN GAME) multiplier on the total number of development points in a region when calculating development point threshold.
(IN GAME) Number of turns the fertility raze penalty is applied.
(IN GAME) Defines penalty public order receives from every damaged building
(IN GAME) Max value for faction province manager repression threshold.
(IN GAME) Max value for faction province manager satisfaction threshold.
(IN GAME) Min value for faction province manager repression threshold.
(IN GAME) Min value for faction province manager satisfaction threshold.

(IN GAME) Public order craskdown bonus when a rebellion is defeated. Must be > 0. Rebellion is defeated in a province you own at least one region in. They are defeated in another faction's region and were spawned by another faction.

(IN GAME) Public order craskdown bonus when a rebellion is defeated. Must be > 0. Rebellion is defeated in a province you own at least one region in. They are defeated in another faction's region, but your faction spawned the rebellion.
(IN GAME) Public order craskdown bonus when a rebellion is defeated. Must be > 0. Rebellion is defeated in a region you owned, but was spawned by another faction.
(IN GAME) Public order craskdown bonus when a rebellion is defeated. Must be > 0. Rebellion is defeated in a region you owned, and was spawned by your faction.
(IN GAME) Amount of PO added per turn whilst in rebellion state

(IN GAME) Additional attitude for faction province a luxury resource is available (and isn't produced locally). Per luxury resource available. Used in faction province public order - resource attitude.
(IN GAME) Additional attitude for faction province if it produces a luxury resource. Per luxury resource produced. Used in faction province public order - resource attitude.
(IN GAME) Minimum resource value for a resource to be luxury. Used in faction province public order - resource attitude.
(IN GAME) Dipolmatic penalty for each faction raided. Positive value X diplomatic penalty.
(IN GAME) Development penalty for each faction province raided. Positive value X accumilated development.
(IN GAME) Public order penalty for each faction province raided. Positive value X happiness.
(IN GAME) Settlement raid building value exponent
(IN GAME) Settlement raid, flat multiplier on raided value
(IN GAME) Settlement raid count of armies base
(IN GAME) Number of characters to create in case of a rebellion
(IN GAME) Rebellion budget calculation factor for the cost of armies in the region and neighbouring region. Result capped at 10000.
(IN GAME) Rebellion budget calculation factor for the cost of garrison armies/navies
(IN GAME) Rebellion budget calculation factor for the total building level in the settlement.
(IN GAME) Rebellion budget calculation factor for the number of active settlement slots.
(IN GAME) Rebellion budget calculation factor for unhappiness level. Result capped at 10000.
(IN GAME) Minimum amount a region building repair can cost, as a percentage of it's construction cost.
(IN GAME) Food consumption in a region for each horde
(IN GAME) Food consumption in a region for each settled horde
(IN GAME) Food consumption in a region for each raiding army
(IN GAME) Additional food consumed by raiding armies in the region they are in. VALUE * number of units, rounded up. Must be greater than 0.0
(IN GAME) Proportion of food stolen from a region given to the raiding armies faction. Must be between 0.0 and 1.0.
(IN GAME) The food penalty after a battle with heavy settlement damage (66+% building damage). Lasts one turn, next turn will use moderate damage penalty.
(IN GAME) The food penalty after a battle with light settlement damage (33-% building damage). Lasts one turn.
(IN GAME) The food penalty after a battle with medium settlement damage (33-66% building damage). Lasts one turn, next turn will use light damage penalty.
(IN GAME) Variable affecting the chance of plague - Chance = (net_squalor * modifier) / (net_squalor + modifier)
(IN GAME) Rate at which support will drift towards 0 when there is no owner to a region
(IN GAME) The maximum distance from the edge of a zone of control a piece can be to reinforce. Clamped between 0.1 and 4.0
(IN GAME) Unary applied to the total unit cost of the enemy alliance to calculate the amount of treasury income received when releasing captives from battle
(IN GAME) Religion drift multiplier. Used for calcuting the religion rate of change in provinces. New religion amount = old + ((new - old) * drift)
(IN GAME) Base replenishment rate for land units in owned or allied regions
(IN GAME) Base replenishment rate for naval units in owned, allied or shared sea regions
(IN GAME) Replenishment rate bonus for land units garrisoned in wholly owned provinces
(IN GAME) Replenishment rate bonus for land units garrisoned in shared provinces
(IN GAME) Replenishment rate bonus for land units in owned regions
(IN GAME) When replacing a unit in a retinue slot, the percentage health lost of the existing unit. E.g Current unit A at X% health, replaced with unit B at (X - THIS)% health.
(IN GAME) After a military force retinue slot unit is destroyed, number of turns before they respawn
(IN GAME) Default value used to track governor independence score modifier value.
(IN GAME) Random factor that is added to round_modifier_since_last_governor_independence_request_default from -X to +X range
(IN GAME) Percentage of building cost refunded when a ruined building is dismantled
(IN GAME) The absolute max number of non child pool entries that the game expects in a ai faction.
(IN GAME) The absolute max number of child pool entries entries that the game expects in a human faction.
(IN GAME) The absolute max number of recruitable characters that the game expects in a ai faction.
(IN GAME) The absolute max number of recruitable characters that the game expects in a human faction.
(IN GAME) Radius around which seperatist armies should spawn from the loyalist capital
(IN GAME) The health points autorepaired to one building in a settlement each turn.
(IN GAME) Num development points to activate secondary slot 1
(IN GAME) Num development points to activate secondary slot 1
(IN GAME) Num development points to activate secondary slot 2
(IN GAME) Num development points to activate secondary slot 2
(IN GAME) Num development points to activate secondary slot 3
(IN GAME) Num development points to activate secondary slot 3
(IN GAME) Num development points to activate secondary slot 4
(IN GAME) Num development points to activate secondary slot 4
(IN GAME) The increase per round of a settlements loot value multiplier.
(IN GAME) Points required to unlock a settlement secondary slot (points specified in campaign_building_chain_slot_unlocks)
(IN GAME) Base repair rate for settlement walls

(IN GAME) Any non-negative value is used to initialise the number of turns a military force can hold out after supplies run out. If a negative value is specified the time is calculated based on the health of the besieged force.
(IN GAME) Amount of damage required to reach escalation level one.
(IN GAME) The siege escalation level that must be reached before damaging the walls will cause wall breaches.
(IN GAME) Max siege effort which a force can provide
(IN GAME) Min siege effort which a force can provide
(IN GAME) Slave point multiplier for captured cities and post battle captives
Bonus for state religion conversion (per region you own in a province)
(IN GAME) The maximum proportion of a trade route which may be commerce raided, in thousandths.
(IN GAME) The proportion of this ships commerce raid value that the next commerce raiding ship downstream on this route will achieve.
(IN GAME) The constant factor by which a factions gdp is multiplied to produce the faction trade resource consumption.
(IN GAME) The strategic value in trade for luxury resources or any resource which is already available to a faction.
(IN GAME) The minimum absolute difference between the current and target prices of a trade resource for the price change to be considered large.
(IN GAME) The minimum absolute difference between the current and target prices of a trade resource for the price change to be considered small.
(IN GAME) The proportion of trade resource value each resource not traded on to other factions contributes to total income
(IN GAME) Each turn the accumulated proportion of trade route values ("time value") is this proportion compared to the previous turn.
(IN GAME) The proportion of the trade route value that gets accumulated each turn, "time factor".
(IN GAME) The proportion of the combined gdps of the two factions which contributes to the value of a trade route.
(IN GAME) The minimum proportion of the square root of the sum of the involved faction's gdps that either faction will recieve in a trade deal.
(IN GAME) Base percentage chance of intercepting a tunnelling army.
(IN GAME) Additional percentage chance of intercepting a tunnelling army if this army tunnelled last turn.
(IN GAME) The maximum distance at which armies can intercept tunnelling armies. Clamped between 0.1 and 25.0
(IN GAME) Base cover point change per turn before bonuses
(IN GAME) Maxmimum cover points a character can have
(IN GAME) base percentage of secondary discover option outcome (e.g. faction chooses execute but character escapes)
(IN GAME) relationship value between the undercover character and another character in the faction to be considered for hire on discover
(IN GAME) Lower random value - length of time undercover characters will spend in the targets character pool without being hired
(IN GAME) if undercover character reaches this loyalty in a foreign faction, they automatically leav them
(IN GAME) undercover character can be hired by discovering faction if loyalty to discover function is >= this
(IN GAME) undercover character refused to counterspy loyalty to source faction is <= this
(IN GAME) Percentage chance of a newly created character having the undercover character enabler
(IN GAME) Percentage chance (0-100) that a new recruitable character can be an undercover character
(IN GAME) rank requirement to provide line of sight to all map characters - may not be the sole requirement
(IN GAME) rank requirement to provide line of sight to spouse - may not be the sole requirement
(IN GAME) To calculate the number of turns before a spy defects to its current faction. THIS * original loyalty to source.
(IN GAME) Multiplier on the undercover character upkeep calculation. Currently (max loyalty + 1 - current loyalty) * THIS
(IN GAME) Upper random value - length of time undercover characters will spend in the targets character pool without being hired
(IN GAME) if undercover character reaches this loyalty in a foreign faction, they automatically join them
(IN GAME) maximum undercover network points for a target faction
(IN GAME) undercover network points REDUCTION if no spies in target faction
(IN GAME) undercover network points gained per turn if character is in this position
(IN GAME) undercover network points gained per turn if character is in this position
(IN GAME) undercover network points gained per turn if character is in this position
(IN GAME) undercover network points gained per turn if character is in this position
(IN GAME) undercover network points gained per turn if character is in this position
(IN GAME) undercover network points gained per turn if character is in this position
(IN GAME) undercover network points gained per turn if character is in this position
(IN GAME) undercover network points gained per turn if character is in this position
(IN GAME) Fatigue penalty for all attackers in a night battle.
(IN GAME) Morale bonus for units defending night battles. Result will be morale + THIS.

(IN GAME) Controls what percentage of XP of the replenished unit is granted to the newly replenished men. This value is then scaled by the proportion of new unit size that the additional men represent.
(IN GAME) Multiple of battle site casualties in vampire mercenary recruitment capacity calculation.
(IN GAME) Unit tier modifier in vampire mercenary recruitment capacity calculation.
(IN GAME) Maximum additional capacity for vampiric mercenary pools.
(IN GAME) Maximum additional percentage by which vampiric mercenary pools will replenish per turn.
(IN GAME) Minimum additional capacity for vampiric mercenary pools.
(IN GAME) Minimum additional percentage by which vampiric mercenary pools will replenish per turn.
(IN GAME) Multiple of battle site casualties in vampire mercenary recruitment replenishment calculation.
(IN GAME) Unit tier modifier in vampire mercenary recruitment replenishment calculation.
(IN GAME) Capacity value required from bonus values and campaign variables to give the maximum additional vampiric mercenary pool capacity.
(IN GAME) Replenishment value required from bonus values and campaign variables to give the maximum additional vampiric mercenary pool replenishment rate.
(IN GAME) Chance of the Winds of Magic changing at the start of round.
(IN GAME) The number of wounds restored when a character is reassigned to a new faction
(IN GAME) Radius of the zone of control for land pieces. Clamped between 0.1 and 8.0
(IN GAME) Radius of the zone of control for naval pieces. Clamped between 0.1 and 15.0
